turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there. I'm Doctor <UNSURE>Deen Mirza</UNSURE> from Babylon. Good morning.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Good morning. Hi, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Good morning. <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, sorry, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, before we start. Could I get your full name and date of birth? Is that possible? <UNSURE>Yes, it's</UNSURE>, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, sure. Um, my name is John Doe. Um, and I am twenty seven years old.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so, I was born in nineteen ninety one, um, seventeenth of November.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's perfect, thank you for that. Are you, um, John, are you in a private place where you're OK to speak at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, perfect, thank you for that. OK. So, tell me what the problem is. You've been having some difficulty breathing. Is that correct?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, yeah, exactly. I've, I'm <UNIN/>, kind of struggling to breathe at the moment. I, I got stung by a wasp, um, recently.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Well, I'm not sure whether it's kind of bitten or stung.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, but I, uh, I'm feeling like slightly anxious that, uh, there's a bit of, I've got a bit of a, a rash on my arm where, i got stung.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and, I've, kind of. But yeah, as I say, I've got this difficulty breathing and potentially, um, there's a bit of swelling in my lips. <UNSURE>My</UNSURE> tongue feels a bit weird.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. So, when did this bee sting or bee bite occur?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it was, just a few minutes ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, and, your, your lips don't seem swollen to me right now, but, do they, which. Can you show me with your finger where you feel it's swollen?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it's just kind of on the right-hand side. Um, and it, and it's just a bit sore, maybe it hasn't kind of <UNIN/>, fully swollen up yet.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sure</UNSURE>, OK. Uh, you said you've been having some difficulty breathing.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Your breathing seems all right to me right now. Um, the reason why I'm, clarifying <UNSURE>is</UNSURE>, because we have to decide whether this is a, an acute emergency. Whether I need to send you in to hospital straight away.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Or whether we, more time to ask questions, OK. So um, <UNIN/>, do you feel like you've got difficulty breathing right now, this minute, as we speak?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I, I, I <UNIN/>, I don't, feel like it's <UNIN/>, like particularly acute, but i'm just kind of a bit anxious that it might get a bit worse. I don't, I just wanted to speak to someone.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sure</UNSURE>, sure. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. No you, uh, you did the right thing and I, and I can understand it <UNIN/>, it is quite anxiety provoking, OK. All right. Can I just double-check? Before we carry on asking other questions. Have you got  history of anaphylaxis?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not that I know of.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Have you ever been given an EpiPen?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I haven't no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK, all right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Let, let's, um, take a step back now. So, in terms of the bee sting, <UNSURE>it was a</UNSURE> <UNIN/>. Did you see a bee or you're, you're just <UNIN/>, um, assuming it was a bee?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I, <UNIN/>, I, I find it difficult to tell the difference between a bee and a wasp, but um, <UNIN/>, yeah it was one of the two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>. One of the two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, OK. And, um, the area of your body that it stung. Where was it? Did you say it was your arm?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it was on my arm.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. And you've got a rash there. Can I have a look?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah sure. Um, it's just, just there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. That looks OK to me right now. <UNIN/>, <UNSURE>does</UNSURE> it look red to you at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's, it's slightly red, yeah and, and kind of there's, a bit of a, like a hole there, where I think that the wasp, stung me.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. The puncture mark, yeah, OK, all right. Um, now, is, is there any swelling, around that area, that you can see? I, I couldn't see any.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not particularly. I, I guess it's just a bit kind of blotchy, uh, and a bit of a rash. It doesn't feel like, particularly swollen. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. OK, all right.Um, now, have you taken any medication? It's probably a <UNIN/>, you probably haven't, 'cause it was a few minutes ago. But have you? Is <UNIN/>. <UNIN/>, not taken <UNIN/>, any <UNIN/>, antihistamines or anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not at the, not at the moment, no. Nothing, nothing yet.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/>, now, um, if I can just go back. Do you have any history of any <UNIN/>, any, kind of illnesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've, I've had eczema before. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, that's kind of the, the major thing, nothing, nothing really.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, OK. Have you, got a history of any allergies to anything?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I'm allergic to penicillin.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right, good. Um, and in your family, is there any history of any illnesses, or, any history of any kind of acute <UNIN/> reactions?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, not that I think is, particularly relevant, no. I don't have, I don't have any.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right. <UNIN/>, and, um, do you have allergies to any kind of, cats, or dogs, or pets, or anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not that I know of, I've <UNIN/>, yeah, I've been around dogs and cats, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. <UNIN/>, and you've got no food allergies as far as you're aware?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, can I ask? Do you suffer from anxiety or panic attacks, or anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, uh, sometimes, occasionally.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Have you ever been on medication for that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, great. Now, um, I need to ask a few questions, maybe not directly related to this, but just, it's for, for general information purposes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, um, <UNIN/>, are you working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What do you work as?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I am a, uh, computer scientist.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, um, <UNIN/>, you living alone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you have any pets at home?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I have a cat, at home.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>A cat</UNSURE>. OK, great.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What I'd like to do now. If that's OK John? Is, I'd like to have a look inside your mouth, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, one of the things that, um, we'd be worried about if, someone's going to have an acute allergic reaction. Is to see whether there's any swelling, of the lips, or the tissues inside the mouth, or the.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Soft tissues of the airway. And, um, I can, I've got a fairly good view of your lips, but I'd like maybe if you can, bring your device closer to your mouth, and then put your head back, mouth open wide. Sit somewhere where there's good lighting. And I just wanna have a look inside the throat, if that's OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Perfect, OK, great. Now, um, um, can, can I just get you to do it again? And, just say ah, this time.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yup</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fantastic, brilliant. OK. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, John. Based on, um, how you look. How you're talking to me, and how you're breathing, and the appearance, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> your wrist.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I don't feel that you're having <UNIN/>, a, an, an, a life-threatening, uh, allergic reaction.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now it's very normal, to have, a rash, when you have some kind of insect bite. It's uh, it's a localised, um, uh, inflammatory reaction, that um, is normal and that <UNIN/>, immediate reaction, that redness, and that maybe slight swelling, is usually temporary.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What we're worried about, is when someone has, um, compromise of their breathing. So you mentioned, breathing difficulties and you mentioned swelling of your lip. Thankfully I can't see any of that right now.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, but that's, the most, urgent and most pressing thing that we'd be watching out for.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Given that it hasn't happened, initially, it's unlikely to happen later. OK we, so we have like a <UNIN/>, stage one and stage two reaction, for these types of bites.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, usually if you're gonna have the reaction, it will happen straight away.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, we may be coming out of the danger zone now, it's um. But I'm just going to warn you about what those signs and symptoms are, in case it happens. So for example.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You would have, swelling of the lips, difficulty breathing. You might have something called stridor, which is an inspiratory sound that you, when you're trying, trying to breathe. It makes like a rasping sound, like this. OK. <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Thankfully, you don't have anything like that right now. It seems to me like this is a localised allergic reaction.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>However, if</UNSURE> anything changes, if anything deteriorates. Either make an appointment with us, or go straight to A and E.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, uh, and in some cases, if it's, if it's, uh, progressing rapidly, it's better to go straight to A and E, rather than to, wait for a booked appointment with us, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What I'd like you to do now, is I'd like you to try and take some antihistamines.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So you can buy <UNSURE>them over the</UNSURE> counter. You can get Piriton or Chlorphenamine, and you can take one tablet, four milligrams, um, up to about six times a day. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Or you can just take a one-a-day one, whichever is your preference, that's, that's absolutely fine, there's no, no issue. That should be enough to control this.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, if, the redness in your arm spreads, and <UNSURE>you, it</UNSURE> feels hot, or you, you know, you have signs of any localised infection.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We may need to think about other treatments, like an antibiotic.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And like I said if anything deteriorates, in terms of your breathing, that's urgent and we need to process that, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, action needs to be taken urgently.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Did <UNSURE>you have</UNSURE> any other, um, queries or was there anything else that you're worried about?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, I think, I think that kind of, that makes me feel a bit better. I guess, can I get that um, can I get the, uh, so the antihistamine from any shop, or like does it <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> pharmacy?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah, that's, that's over the</UNSURE>, yeah <UNIN/>, over the counter. You don't need to, any chemist, will have it, you don't need a prescription for that. Yeah, it's probably cheaper to buy it over the counter actually, than to get it via prescription.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, now, um, uh, on the basis of what you've told me, I don't think you need any allergy testing. I think this is just a <UNIN/>, a straightforward localised reaction to a, an insect bite.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: However, if it was to happen that, you know, this, you're, you're having these kind of reactions on a regular basis or other, <UNIN/>, non-specific rashes. We might need to think about blood testing, I don't think we're at, at that moment yet. OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So uh, but <UNIN/>, that's something to bear in mind in case this, becomes a recurrent pattern.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK then, so, we'll leave it like that for now, OK. I'm gonna leave a <UNSURE>link</UNSURE> to some information about anaphylactic reactions, just for you to read about it. I don't want you to panic, but just for you to be aware what <UNIN/> symptoms are.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: If those kind of things happen, get back to us.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: If you're feeling worried, just have a lower threshold for <UNIN/>, having a chat with us, sometimes a chat is all you need to calm things down.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, great. Yeah, that makes sense.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right then John, OK. Uh, <UNSURE>well</UNSURE> we'll leave it like that, <UNIN/>, come back to us if you have any further issues.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. Thanks. I appreciate your time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: My pleasure. All right, take care then. All the best.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Bye bye, bye.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bye <UNSURE>bye</UNSURE>.
